comment.author: 8110957@N08
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called ANYTHING GOES ENGLAND,VINTAGE PHOTOS,POSTCARDS,EPHEMERAetc..., and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment.author: 24052676@N03
comment._content: Sledding and rolling down the hill now not "allowed" as it is deemed too dangerous by health & safety...............................when will they ever get a life?

comment.author: 8110957@N08
comment._content: Say it isn't so!!!! If we thought like that here in British Columbia, there would be no skiing allowed, and definitely no snowboarding! I guess we wouldn't have much of an Olympics next February here, and in Whistler. In case people are wondering about the "hill rolling", here is a link to an old print of the strange happenings on Bank Holidays: www.flickr.com/photos/mando_gal/3201193596/in/set-7215760...

comment.author: 24052676@N03
comment._content:
There are metal railings at the bottom of the steeper hills.

Would it hurt if we were allowed to use our own common sense.?

Next thing you know we'll have signs up reminding us the pavements might be wet when it rains.......

comment.author: 61308567@N02
comment._content: Up the top of that hill just beyond the Observatory and in the centre of the walkway, a statue of General Wolfe, Liberator of Quebec and the reason that Canada does not all speak French now; but I cannot spot in this picture's definition try as I might.

comment.author: 24052676@N03
comment._content: Maybe the date of 1933 isn't quite accurate, Wolfe's statue was only erected in 1930.

comment.author: 11334970@N05
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/61308567@N02] 
Hi surreydweller,

Nice spot! 

The 1933 date was used because the 'Fame' is still in front of the Queen’s House, and no one looked further back to the hill!

We don't have any further information to date this image so all the help you can give us is greatly appreciated.

Thanks

Lucinda
